task_summary: The robot, already holding a grid clamp, approaches a precise placement location on the workboard, gently lowers until contact, aligns by yaw, places with light force, releases, and retreats safely. [image:1]

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style collaborative arm with a parallel gripper operates over a wooden work surface with a line of small clamps visible, executing the final placement of a single grid clamp onto a designated spot near a guide rail. The sequence emphasizes approach, fine alignment, controlled vertical contact, compliant placement, release, and clean retreat without disturbing neighboring pieces. [image:1]
preconditions: Grid clamp is already secured in the gripper at the start of the shown segment. [image:1]
A valid placement pose on the board exists and is referenced as 'place_on_table'. [image:1]
Workspace around the target area is clear of obstacles that would block vertical approach. [image:1]
stepwise_plan: Verify the clamp is in the gripper, move above the target, and set the end-effector yaw to match the lineup. [image:1]
Approach and align in-plane to refine lateral error before descent. [image:1]
Lower slowly until contact, then place to the keyed pose with low press force, open the gripper, and retreat vertically. [image:1]
success_criteria: Clamp rests stably at the target pose with correct yaw and no displacement of adjacent clamps. [image:1]
Gripper releases fully and the arm clears the area by a safe margin. [image:1]
failure_and_recovery: If contact is detected early or misalignment occurs, retreat slightly, realign using ApproachAndAlign, and retry the descent. [image:1]
If the clamp slips during release, re-grasp if possible, re-approach, and repeat placement with lower press force. [image:1]
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful release and a confirmed retreat distance that clears the placement zone. [image:1]

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear low-height approach with the tool centered over the target, indicating onset of contact phase. [image:1]
frame_3.predicts_next: Release action likely follows after compliant placement, matching a place-then-open sequence. [image:1]
frame_3.uncertainty_reduction: Confirms the task is placement (not pick) and clarifies approach vector as vertical. [image:1]

node_specs.description: Confirms the clamp is currently held before attempting placement. [image:1]
Moves to a safe pre-place height above the target area. [image:1]
Orients the end-effector to match the row alignment of clamps. [image:1]
In-plane approach and fine alignment to reduce lateral error. [image:1]
Controlled vertical descent until gentle contact is detected. [image:1]
Constrained placement at the target pose with light press force. [image:1]
Backs away to clear the cluttered zone safely. [image:1]

failure_modes: Early contact due to residual lateral misalignment causing tip-over or bounce. [image:1]
Insufficient opening during release causing the part to lift with the gripper. [image:1]
Neighbor interference if approach yaw is incorrect. [image:1]
recovery_strategy: Retreat slightly, re-run ApproachAndAlign, and retry LowerUntilContact with the same press force. [image:1]
If part sticks after opening, close to re-grasp, lift a bit, re-align, and place again. [image:1]
Adjust SetTCPYaw by small increments and repeat alignment if visual cues indicate skew. [image:1]
assumptions: The episode segment depicts a placement (object already grasped) rather than a pick. [image:1]
The target region corresponds to a row/rail on the left side of the workspace, represented as 'place_on_table'. [image:1]

expected_success_criteria: Final pose matches target within 5 mm lateral tolerance and correct yaw, with no disturbance to adjacent items. [image:1]
test_scenarios: grasp_fail (simulated even though start expects held) [image:1]
